intro: Hemitelia aculeata, commonly known as the prickly hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Hemitelia aculeata is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
